thread.title: Sheila Dikshit downplays 'Rahul Gandhi lacks maturity' remark, tweets #DontTwistMyWords | Zee News
thread.title_full: Sheila Dikshit downplays 'Rahul Gandhi lacks maturity' remark, tweets #DontTwistMyWords | Zee News

title: Sheila Dikshit downplays 'Rahul Gandhi lacks maturity' remark, tweets #DontTwistMyWords | Zee News
text:
Sheila Dikshit downplays 'Rahul Gandhi lacks maturity' remark, tweets #DontTwistMyWords By Zee Media Bureau | Last Updated: Friday, February 24, 2017 - 14:31 0 Follow @ZeeNews 
New Delhi: After initially suggesting that Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi lacks political maturity , former Delhi chief minister Sheila Dikshit on Friday backtracked, urging people not to twist her words. 
Responding to media reports, Dikshit tweeted: ''Rahul has the sensitivity and concern of a mature leader. His words are those of a young, courageous and restless man.'' 
Urging people not to misread her words, she also tweeted #DontTwistMyWords. Rahul has the sensitivity and concern of a mature leader. His words are those of a young, courageous and restless man. #DontTwistMyWords 
â€” Sheila Dikshit (@SheilaDikshit) February 24, 2017 
In an interview with the Times Of India , she had reportedly opined that the party vice president still lacks maturity and needs some time. 
Sheila Dikshit, who withdrew as Congress CM candidate in Uttar Pradesh after her party's stitched an electoral alliance with Akhilesh Yadav-led Samajwadi Party, also refuted charges that she had stopped campaigning for the party in the state after that. 
The Congress veteran was also quoted as saying, ''I have not stopped campaigning for Congress.'' MUST READ Rahul Gandhi still lacks maturity, needs more time: Sheila Dikshit 
Talking about the Congress-SP tie-up, Dikshit said, ''There were some initial hiccups but all has been sorted out. This is the era of visibility and Akhilesh is way above everyone else. Mayawati does not have that style so she is there but not too much. BJP does not have a leader for UP. The PM is going there very frequently but everyone understands that he will not be CM.'' 
She also expressed hope that Muslims and Dalits will support the SP-Congress alliance in UP. 
Dikshit stressed that the joint campaigning by Rahul and Akhilesh has had a positive impact on voters in UP. 
When asked why Congress is shrinking to the periphery in several states, Dikshit said, ''The political language has changed quite a lot. In this change of approach, link, language and relationships, Congress is adjusting itself. And, please remember, Rahul is still not mature, his age does not allow him to be mature. He is what... in his forties. Please give him time. Having said all this, Congress believes in development of the weak and marginalised. Rahul is the only one who has spoken about farmers.'' 
When asked how much time should Rahul Gandhi be given, Dikshit said, ''I think he has come a long way. He is not yet prime minister because that opportunity will come later but he is doing things. He is attending meetings and he is one person who is known to speak his mind. I feel it is good that he is natural but if some feel that it is not so then one develops it on the way.'' 
Dikshit also expressed hope that Rahul Gandhi will be elevated as Congress chief by the end of this year. Dikshit also hailed Priyanka Gandhi as ''very sensitive and intelligent.'' First Published: Friday, February 24, 2017 - 14:31 More from zeenews
